summary:
This LA City Council meeting was mostly routine business with some significant public comment on two main issues:

**KEY DECISIONS**
• Approved multiple lawsuit settlements totaling over $5.6 million (largest was $2.625 million in the Roselina Reyes case)
• Voted 11-0 on various agenda items after public comment period
• Reconsidered item 32 to move it to Friday's meeting in Van Nuys for more community input

**NOTABLE DISCUSSIONS**
• **Olympic Wage Controversy**: Multiple speakers defended the recently passed Olympic wage ordinance for tourism workers, claiming companies like Delta and United are trying to pressure the city to weaken it through threats and lobbying
• **Kratom/7-OH Ban Debate**: Several speakers opposed a proposed ban on kratom and 7-hydroxymitragynine (called "7-OH"), arguing these substances help people with chronic pain and addiction recovery, and that banning them would push users to more dangerous illegal drugs

**BOTTOM LINE**
The meeting highlighted ongoing tensions over LA's new tourism worker wage requirements ahead of the 2028 Olympics, with workers and advocates pushing back against corporate pressure to roll back the policy. The council also heard passionate testimony about kratom regulation, with users arguing for harm reduction over prohibition.
